security: The document discusses intelligence activities and assessments related to Cuba, Vietnam, and Soviet capabilities, including specific details about personnel, covert operations, and technical intelligence. Exposing these details could reveal sources and methods, compromising ongoing operations and intelligence collection efforts. Quoting directly: 'CIA has a number of integrated covert operations which were approved by the Standing Group and by the President...The elements of the integrated program are: Intelligence collection, both strategic and operational...'
summary: Minutes from a September 1963 meeting of the President's Foreign Intelligence Advisory Board (PFIAB) covering topics like counterintelligence, covert actions in Cuba, the Vietnam situation, and intelligence capabilities, including discussions with DCI John McCone and McGeorge Bundy.
summary_one_paragraph: This document summarizes the proceedings of the President's Foreign Intelligence Advisory Board (PFIAB) meeting held on September 12-13, 1963. The meeting included discussions on counterintelligence programs (with Raymond Rocca substituting for James Angleton), covert actions and intelligence operations relating to Cuba (led by Desmond Fitzgerald), and the situation in Vietnam (as assessed by DCI John McCone). The board also reviewed intelligence community capabilities, SIGINT activities, and received updates from McGeorge Bundy, the President's Special Assistant for National Security Affairs, regarding intelligence support to the White House. Key topics included concerns about NSA security lapses (Dunlap case), the effectiveness of CIA's personnel security programs, and the lack of a clear plan for Cuba post-Castro.
title: MEETING OF THE PRESIDENT'S FOREIGN INTELLIGENCE ADVISORY BOARD ON SEPTEMBER 12-13, 1963
sender: PFIAB (President's Foreign Intelligence Advisory Board ) (Memorandum for the File from the White House Staff )
